name: N-(4-decylphenyl)-4-methylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2315
Reason: 4-Decylphenyl and methylbenzamide have different melting points. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The introduction of the phenyl group increases the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. The decyl group (C1CCCCCCCCCC) adds approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The methyl group (C) adds approximately +10 due to the increase in molecular weight and the presence of a methyl group, which can increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding.
